captions.text:
I'm afraid I have some bad news. I don't really
know how to tell you this, but according to
your test results, you are not pregnant.
But Doctor how can this be?

Well, I don't know how you- is that a wine
bottle?

I'm sorry, it's past noon and you just told
me I'm not pregnant. I'm coping. I'm celebrating.

I'm copebrating. I'm celebroting. Call it
what you will.

Did you specifically bring in a wine bottle
just so you could-

It's how I deal with stressful situations,
doctor!

Really Mom, is "stressful situation" your
new term for seeing a fully clothed man?

Shay! Mommy just lost a child! A child, Shay.
Be nice!

Yeah Shay, Mom's going through a lot right
now! Losing a baby is a traumatic event!

Well, good thing she has the abortion queen
of Johnson County by her side.

I know you're trying to insult me, but they're
actually naming a wing of the clinic after

me. So let's see who's laughing when I'm cutting
the ribbon on the Cameron Van Buren Center
for Vacuum Research & Fetus Disposal!

Cameron, I don't really think that this is
the kind of thing that anybody should be laughing
about-

Cool it, Mikayla. You're a prime example of
why this city should okay abortions into the
30th trimester-

Girls, girls! You are all treasures! Lovely,
accidental treasures! Mistakes, but treasures.

Now, doctor if this isn't a baby inside of
my stomach, what exactly is it?

Well, how long have you been under the assumption
that you were pregnant?
I don't know two, maybe three years.
What?!

I admit, I thought it was a little long, but
you know, I was pregnant with Mikayla for
sixteen months.

Jesus, that explains why she's the size of
Polly Pocket.
I know.

Alright, first of all, unless you gave birth
to a hammerhead shark, you did not have a

16 month pregnancy. Second, Mrs. Van Buren,
how much exactly do you drink?

Well, not much. I mean, I'll have a glass
and a half of wine at lunch. Then, nothing

like an ice cold zima when the sun's setting.
Zinfandel spritzers while I'm cooking dinner

for the girls. Red, not white. Several gin
and tonics with my evening meal, which take

me straight into dessert and some delicious
cherry wine. Then I'll curl up with the latest

issue of O Magazine and half a bottle of scotch.
Then a quick shot of whiskey before bed so

my dreams are peculiar and nice. Come morning,
I can hardly get out of bed without a spicy

bloody mary- Can you blame me, se–or, I
like the bite, cha cha! Then a couple of wine

coolers, two, three, in the mid-morning for
energy, zappo! and what do you know we're

back at lunch and it means wine time in my
book.

Good god. In my professional opinion, I would
have to say that the growth which you believed

to be a two-year-old child growing in your
belly, who by the way would be able to talk

by now, is nothing more than a tremendous
amount of fat
Everyone gasps.
Gross.

You might want to put yourself on a liver
transplant list, cause you're going to need
a head start.

In my defense doctor, I did think I was drinking
for two!

Goddamit Mom, did you really drag me out of
school just to find out that you're a fatass!

Yeah Mom, I was supposed to get an anal bleaching
and a Brazilian today, and I was on jury duty,
I just didn't go.
Girls night!

No Mom! It's not girls night at all! It's
the middle of the goddamn day. How about you
step up to the plate and be a mommy for once?
Pizza Street?
Ooh yeah! Fun!...etc.

That's right girls, great, here's forty dollars.
I'll see you when you get home. All this news
has made Mommy very ti-ti!
Uh, you can't go to sleep here.
Hello, do you serve happy meals?
The only true happiness comes in death.
Oh...so is- is that a yes or a-
No. We only have pizza.
Okay. Well, do you have a kids menu?
We have smaller pizzas.
Ooh! Do they come with a toy?
It comes with a small white table.
Cool!...I guess I'll have a pepperoni then.
One children's pepperoni-

Wait, are the pepperonis regular-sized or
kid-sized?

The pepperonis are regular-sized. I know,
it's a travesty.
That it is. Just cheese then.
One children's cheese pizza.
Can I have my toy now?
Yes, in fact, here's 250 of them.
Ooh! Tables! Byeeeeee!!!!!
Dieeeeee!!!!!!!
Hieeeeee!!!!!!
Welcome to Pizza Stree-

Hey Bridget, I was just- oh I didn't realize
you had a friend here. Hi there, Terry Doleman

manager here at Pizza Street. Ah, well, Assistant
Manager...technically...officially... but
one day! Believe it, then achieve it!
Well, that was weird.

What's really weird is that I work in a restaurant,
yet I haven't washed my hands since Sunday.
What?
What do you want to order?
How are your salads?
Good as our pizza. Which is not good.
Bridget! Remember that talk we had last night?

You mean the one where you asked me if I liked
your sausage pizza, and then pointed at your

genitals, and then said get it, get it, sausage
pizza, I'm talking about my penis.

No! No! The one about having a positive attitude
in the workplace! Happy face makes a happy

place! Ub! My god! That just made me think
of something to put on my vision board! I'll
be right back.

Here's a vision: a 27 year old woman spending
every waking moment working in the bowels

of hell. Oh wait, that's a nightmare. A nightmare
I call my life.
Wow. Great. TMI but thanks.

So just the salad, or would you like to hear
about our wonderful selection of croutons?

Oh I didn't realize there was a selection
of croutons-
There's not.

Well then yeah, just the salad. Ooh, unless
you have, like, tiny chopped up hot dogs.

No, this is Pizza Street, not a toddler's
kitchen.
Then I guess a salad.
Next!
Cameron walks up.
Next!
Uh, what the fuck? I haven't even ordered?!
Can't blame a girl for trying.

Whatever, give me a slice of pizza. No cheese.
No sauce. Gluten free crust. Do you have protein
boosts?

Are you sure you don't want a glass of diet
air with that?
Is that supposed to be some kind of joke?
You got me. We only have full calorie air.

Oh my God, I had no idea that Kathy Fucking
Griffin was working at Pizza Street today!

Hilarious! Listen, I'm sorry that you're,
well, you but I didn't come here to get harassed

by some ginger nightmare who's jealous that
I'm busy jet-setting across Johnson and Sedgwick

Counties with my 31 year old boyfriend in
his 2011 Chevy Avalanche!
Hey hey hey what's going on here?
Are you the manager?

Well yes! I mean, no. I mean... well what's
the issue?

Well, this fucking twat-faced twat thinks
she's fucking hilarious!

I think many things about myself. I assure
you that is not one of them.

She's over here working out her fucking stand
up routine while I'm trying to order a goddamn
slice of gluten, sauce, and cheese free pizza.

I'm so sorry. I did not mean to interrupt
you from ordering your wafer.

Hey hey hey now, Bridget. Come on, customer's
always right.
Yes, right about to pass out from malnourishment.
Hey!

Oh sorry, didn't mean to use a multi-syllabic
word in front of you.

Oh yeah, okay, how about I come back there
and kick your ass?
How about I give you an IQ test?

Now ladies, ladies, may I remind you this
is a family establishment.

Is that why you tried to make a family with
me in the walk-in freezer last night?

Oh, ho, ho, come on now Bridget nobody here
was trying to make a family last night.

Yeah not with your one ball and my ovarian
cysts.

Ewwww, one ball. Only tetherball and T-ball
should have a single ball.

Well I've got a single ball, and I'm not ashamed
of it!
Ewww!

I am a proud survivor of testicular cancer
right here! Live strong that's what I say!
Wear the bracelet every day!

Ew, isn't that that guy who took a bunch of
steroids and then lost his nut?

HE WAS FRAMED! That man is a treasure! He
raised millions of dollars, saved thousands

of lives, but you cheat at one little bike
race and all of a sudden you're Mussolini.
Who?
Shocker.

Bridget, I'm a little bit worked up. I'm gonna
take some tater tots to the buffet. You think
you can handle things yourself?
Don't worry boss, I won't let you down...
...on me ever again.
You guys have a buffet?

You couldn't possibly be interested in the
buffet.
No, I just didn't realize you had one.
$4.25 all you can eat. Quite the deal.

Ugh, 4.25 for a buffet. Who the fuck would
want to eat that?
Here's five dollars. Keep the change!

Hmm, cheese. Extra cheese. Meh. Pepperoni.
Hmm, sausage. Oh, pepperoni and sausage. I

like what they did there. Hmm. Veggie, ew.
Oh what is this, a bushel of potatoes? Now

we're talking! Oh what is this? Individual
string cheeses? Unwrapped? Well there goes

half my effort! Oh, Goldfish crackers! I'll
take a hot dog. I'd better take another one

in case this doesn't fill me up. I better
take another one in case I meet a friend.

I better take another one just in case that
doesn't fill my friend up. I better take another
one just in case I drop one on the way over.
